item.title: Adding 634 maps to you 317 Client!
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“deanooo386, post:17, topic:436744”]well i followed this tutorial and it does not work gzip ? im guessing u mean winzip eg just plain old .zip. I replaced all files using toms cache tool i added the text you supplied in correct places, also i added maps to my client statup up .bat and when i log in i just get a plain old black screen …

ok gzip = .tar but still doesnt work the chatbar and skill interface comes up but mini map and screen is all black… and do i .tar the files inside that folder or including that folder ???

and how do i add maps like this ?

start javaw -cp bin -Xms812m -Xmx1024m client 10 0 highmem members 32 maps();

please dont flame for learning as we all do at some point.[/quote]

gzip is .gz
maps() goes in startup method in the client

Read full topic

item.title: Adding 634 maps to you 317 Client!
item.dc:creator: @Lost_Valentino Lost Valentino
item.description:
@Lost_Valentino wrote:

[CENTER]Hey guys, today im going to show you how to add 634 maps.

I know this has been released and you can use penor’s tutorial but there are still people asking me how to add it.

So first some pictures of what you’re adding:

mtmnhv.png755×334

xp8mt2.png1358×698


axedxx.png760×336

hs9s38.png1361×699

10wqfih.png1359×699

wre7ba.png1358×699

spdlpy.png760×499


il9co4.png762×340

aafa1c.png759×286




2jcasrp.png760×334

So there we go:

1: Download this map index.rar and replace it with you map_index in your cache using Toms Cache suite.

PATH: View/Edit Jagex Archives > versionlist.jag > replace map_index

2: Download the 525 objects here Download 525Objects.zip @ UppIT and replace them in your cache

PATH: View/Edit Jagex Archives > config.jag > replace loc.dat and loc.idx

3: Open up OnDemandFetcher and replace your method start( with this:

[CODE]public int mapAmount = 0;

public void start(StreamLoader streamLoader, client client1)
{
    byte[] abyte2 = streamLoader.getDataForName("map_index");
    Stream stream2 = new Stream(abyte2);
    int j1 = abyte2.length / 6;
    mapIndices1 = new int[j1];
    mapIndices2 = new int[j1];
    mapIndices3 = new int[j1];
    for(int i2 = 0; i2 < j1; i2++)
    {
        mapIndices1[i2] = stream2.readUnsignedWord();
        mapIndices2[i2] = stream2.readUnsignedWord();
        mapIndices3[i2] = stream2.readUnsignedWord();

mapAmount++;
}
System.out.println(“Map Amount: “+mapAmount+””);
abyte2 = streamLoader.getDataForName(“midi_index”);
stream2 = new Stream(abyte2);
j1 = abyte2.length;
anIntArray1348 = new int[j1];
for(int k2 = 0; k2 < j1; k2++)
anIntArray1348[k2] = stream2.readUnsignedByte();

    clientInstance = client1;
    running = true;
    clientInstance.startRunnable(this, 2);
}[/CODE]

Make a map in you cache called: /cache/maps
And place this files into it: 634 DecyptedIdx5Files.rar
Gzip them and done.

4: Go into client.java and add these methods somewhere:

[CODE]public void maps() {
for(int MapIndex = 0; MapIndex < 3536; MapIndex++) {
byte[] abyte0 = GetMap(MapIndex);
if(abyte0 != null && abyte0.length > 0) {
decompressors[4].method234(abyte0.length, abyte0, MapIndex);
}
}
}

	public byte[] GetMap(int Index) {
	try {
		File Map = new File("./Maps/"+Index+".gz");
		byte[] aByte = new byte[(int)Map.length()];
		FileInputStream Fis = new FileInputStream(Map);
			Fis.read(aByte);
			System.out.println(""+Index+" aByte = ["+aByte+"]!");
			Fis.close();
		return aByte;
	} catch(Exception e) {
		return null;
	}
}



public static final byte[] ReadFile(String s, boolean antiLeech) {
	try {
		byte abyte0[];
		File file = new File(s);
		int i = (int)file.length();
		abyte0 = new byte[i];
		DataInputStream datainputstream = new DataInputStream(new BufferedInputStream(new FileInputStream(s)));
		datainputstream.readFully(abyte0, 0, i);
		datainputstream.close();
		return abyte0;
	} catch(Exception e) {
		System.out.println((new StringBuilder()).append("Read Error: ").append(s).toString());
		return null;
	}
}[/CODE]

5: add this in you startup method:

maps();

6: add this at the end in your cache:
Download flo.dat.Valentino.rar @ UppIT

PATH: View/Edit Jagex Archives > config.jag > replace flo.dat

Compile and you’re done!
DONT FORGET TO GZIP ALL .DAT FILES

Remember there are still a few bugs and i don’t have the 634 objects so instead i use 525 objects.

Credits:
Penor
Flamable
Mige5
Valentino[/center]

Read full topic
